lead_paragraph: Worrying about hackers and viruses is becoming a way of life for Windows users, but Macintosh owners should not assume they are immune to Internet ills. For them, Symantec has announced Version 2 of its Norton Personal Firewall for Macintosh ($69.95 or $39.95 for an upgrade). The program is also available ($99.95 or $69.95 for the upgrade) in the larger Norton Internet Security suite, which includes Norton Anti-Virus and Aladdin's iClean clutter-reducing software. Symantec has also updated its Norton Utilities and Norton AntiVirus software, along with its SystemWorks suite. The updated programs include versions written specifically for Mac OS X and separate versions for Mac OS 8.1 to OS 9. (Details can be found at www.symantec.com/mac.)

headline.main: Stopping Hackers, While Doing Detective Work on the Side

abstract: Symantec announces Version 2 of its Norton Personal Firewall for Macintosh users; program is also available in larger Norton Internet Security suite, which includes Norton Anti-Virus and Aladdin's iClean clutter-reducing software; photo (S)
